item.title: Optimizing Scheduler Search in TVM
item.author: wiparker2020@gmail.com (William Parker)
item.description:
Introduction

Machine Learning Compiler Frameworks like Apache TVM’s Ansor
optimize schedulers for inference. The software runs a search algorithm, optimizing a model for the specific hardware configuration. Apache TVM integrates with all popular model frameworks, allowing for optimizations in inference latency, improved throughput, and memory usage optimization. For this project, we combine and evaluate the efficiency of two additional techniques used to improve Ansor: transfer-tuning and droplet search. In our tests, we find that combining these two techniques can lead to an improvement of up to 10% faster inference than using transfer-tuning alone.
